maintenance-item.para: The Front Destination Sign (FDS) displays text strings (the destination station) sent by the Communication Control Unit.

The FDS unit is located at the F-end of the C Car, at the bottom of the left side windshield, and bolted to supports attached to the window structure. (See Figure .) The unit weighs approximately 9 lb and its extruded aluminium body, painted black, measures approximately 6.0 in. high, 24.5 in. wide, and 4.2 in. deep.
The display face of the FDS unit is oriented outside the train, pressed against the windshield. A neoprene foam gasket between the display face and windshield seals against dust and liquids.
The cabin side of the FDS unit is protected by a metallic shroud. The shroud is hinged at the bottom edge, to ease maintenance, and secured with two captive, tamper-resistant quarter-turn fasteners.
The FDS has a touch pad assembly with one pushbutton and three indicators.(See Table .)

A two-plug car wiring cable connects the 12-pin FDS connector, providing both car battery power and connections to the Data Car Network (DCN). A ground wire connects the FDS ground stud to the carbody. (See Table .)

entry.para: 74 Vdc car battery power, supplied through 2-pole, 10 A circuit breaker SIGNS (CB46)

row.entry: Sign location and identification jumper pins
Connection lines to the Data Car Network
